HBA Boston - Crossing Boundaries on the Road to Innovation: Avoiding IP Pitfalls Along the Way When: Thursday, September 22nd, 2011 Where: Infinity Pharmaceuticals, 780 Memorial Drive, Cambridge, MA 02139 (The closest T Stop is Central Square on the Red Line. Infinity has onsite parking after 5 pm. Click here for directions: http://maps.google.com/maps/place?cid=3860642198952739901&q=Infinity+Pharmaceuticals+,+780+Memorial+Drive,+Cambridge,+MA+02139-4613&hl=en&ved=0CBEQ-gswAA&sa=X&ei=GS4zTtm3O4_0zASSh_2wCQ&sig2=XqAULlbH9pmFNYqOdvBiZQ) Register: http://www.hbanet.org (Online registration is open through September 15, 2011; onsite registration is allowed. Space is limited to the first 100 registrants.) What is involved in acquiring and protecting intellectual property? Why is this important to the overall success of your company? Does the intellectual strategy change as a company grows from idea to start up to a company with marketable products? Come to a panel discussion of seasoned professionals and find out! Our Crossing Boundaries series continues with our latest event: Crossing boundaries on the road to innovation: Avoiding IP pitfalls along the way on September 22, 2011. This program will consist of two parts - a brief introduction to patents followed by a panel discussion. The first part will describe the form, function, and future of patents. The second part will be a panel discussion surrounding the issues and pitfalls associated with IP as one moves from innovation to marketed product including: IP capture, tracking and triage, IP transfer and IP commercialization. Learn how what you do (whether scientist or accountant) matters with regard to intellectual property and learn how to protect it. Event is open to both HBA members and nonmembers. Learning Objectives:

1. Identify the form and function of an IP patent.

2. Learn the issues and pitfalls (and how to avoid them) in protecting IP along the value chain.

3. Learn what you can do to protect your institution’s IP.

Agenda:

5:30 – 6:15 PM Registration/Networking

6:15 – 6:25 PM Welcome/Opening Remarks, Introduction of Moderator

6:25 – 6:45 PM Patents 101

6:45 – 8:00 PM Introduction of Topic and Panelists/Panel Discussion/Q&A

8:00 – 8:15 PM Closing Remarks

8:15 – 9:00 PM Networking
